Waxy

I saw them last night here in Calgary, the only Canadian stop on their tour, and I just gotta tell someone.
 
 I had the best seats for a concert I've ever had, row 2, seat 5. By halfway through the concert I was standing right in front of the stage. That alone made the experience incredible. It's almost surreal to be that close to the band.
 
 On top of that, they are an incredibly impressive band live. Stevie Nicks still sounds great and Lyndsey Buckingham blew my mind, that man can flat out play a guitar, and his style is so unique, Mick's drum solo was pretty amazing too.
 
 I saw Aerosmith a couple months back, and for me there was no comparison, Fleetwood Mac was hands down the better band. I've seen Bo Diddley and Merle Haggard in the last month too, and I love Merle Haggard, but FM put on a better show than both of them no question. :p
 
 Without my amazing seat, they're easily in my top 10 concerts of all time, with my seats, probably in the top 5.
 
 Anyone else seen them or going to see them?
 
 Waxy

It was in '77 or '78 when they were really popular that I began to listen to them. I had an 8track at the time, 66 Mustang, Baby Blue with Baby Moon hub caps. I would crank them up and me and a few friends would pop-a-top.
 Sara and You Make Loving Fun were my two favorites and still are. My kids like them, too...now, since I have the CD and play them alot.
 
 Glad to to have some Mac friends around... emoticon_xgood

I don't know, I think I might be to old to be a rock star. I can't enjoy any of the perks anymore. :p
 
 I'm getting married in a week, so, there goes the sex.
 
 I'm getting worse and worse hangovers all the time and I just don't get the kick out it that I used too, so, there goes the drugs.
 
 I don't rock out like I used to either, but I guess I still have the a bit of the rock n' roll.
 
 Can you be in a band if you've only got one of the three bases covered? :p 
 
 Also, if you heard me sing, you'd no that isn't good for ANYONE.
 
 The Liquid Paper thing has potential though.
